p: Family Lamiaceae or Labiatae popularly known as Mint family contains 236 genera and 6900â€“7000 species of aromatic plants [ 13]. Members of this family are herbs (perennial or annual herbs), shrubs, and trees. Stems are herbaceous rarely woody, prostrate and branched. Leaves are simple and oppositely arranged, rarely whorled, petiolate or sessile, hairy with characteristic aroma due to presence aromatic essential oils.
